questDatabase.name: Welcome to Tier 2
questDatabase.description: Why, hello there! Seems you've made it into electrical age. But behold, do not throw your steam machines away, you'll probably want to use them until you reach Tier 3

questDatabase.name: Damn you, wirecutter!
questDatabase.description: Enough is enough. No more wasting of gazillions of ingots just for a couple of wires. Now that you have power, you should go for a wiremill!

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #1
questDatabase.description: The first item you'll need a lot of. If you want to pull items out of Chests or Barrels you need one.

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #3
questDatabase.description: The third item you'll need a lot of, and is also a pain to craft. Probably, the most painfull item ever...

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #2
questDatabase.description: The second item you'll need a lot of. When you want to get the Fluid out of the Thanks you need one.

questDatabase.name: Electric macerator
questDatabase.description: It is highly recommended to get one of these, as the efficiency in terms of coal/steam used to macerate something is a lot better when using EU here

questDatabase.name: You gonna hate this #4
questDatabase.description: A piston, but more .. "Electrical". The 4th item you gonna craft a lot in the future

questDatabase.name: Saving redstone
questDatabase.description: Tired of using 4 redstone for one magnetic rod? Well, good news for you! The polarizer doesn't need redstone, just a little bit of power. You don't need to attach this machine to a permanent power source, it runs fine on batteries

questDatabase.name: Avengers, assemble!
questDatabase.description: An absolute must have for fans of the movie. Oh, and to make all the things, of course.

questDatabase.name: No more filing
questDatabase.description: Why wasting a full ingot to make a rod, that needs a tool which looses durability and takes even more ingots? With just this little device, all your rod-needs shall be fulfilled (for now)

questDatabase.name: Bzzz
questDatabase.description: Optional machine. Like the forming press, you don't really *need* it in the 32 EU age. Not mandatory to proceed

questDatabase.name: Press all the things
questDatabase.description: An optional machine, if you want to make circuits more efficient. Not mandatory in 32 EU age, so if you're short on steel, you can skip this device and build the next tier then

questDatabase.name: Electric forge hammer
questDatabase.description: Not really required, but it is a lot faster than the steam one. And it can be automated. There are no recipes that require more than steam level to hammer something

questDatabase.name: Cutting things apart
questDatabase.description: An absolutely mandatory machine to have. It will cut rods into bolts, plates into casings, and that with the highest possible efficiency. Totally worth it!

questDatabase.name: Get ready for Tier 3
questDatabase.description: In order to proceed forward, you need to get Aluminium. A lot of. But for now, one is enough to unlock this quest. Probably the best source for Aluminium is clay, but you need a MV machine for that. So you need to find an alternative until you have enough dusts for your first machine

questDatabase.name: Your magic progression
questDatabase.description: Now that you are able to produce Aluminium, you may dig into magic. If you haven't unlocked basic thaumaturgy, try to find a silverwood and a greatwood sapling

questDatabase.name: The missing one
questDatabase.description: <basdxz> But ffs, add a plate bender to the LV tier book

questDatabase.name: Your first automation
questDatabase.description: Well, probably not the first, but definitely something big! First you need a cart assembler

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Power
questDatabase.description: Your cart needs power, obviously. A cart can be powered by solar and lava; But for now you have to use a simple coal engine

questDatabase.name: Automated (un-)loading
questDatabase.description: You can fill and empty your cart manually, but it's a lot more convenient to automate that; Isn't it?

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Farming
questDatabase.description: Unfortunately, the basic farmer can't farm anything besides wheat; But it's not expensive at all, and probably the cheapest solution to give your automated food production a boost

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Storage
questDatabase.description: A basic cart can't hold any items, so you need to attach chests to it

questDatabase.name: A simple cart
questDatabase.description: In order to create or customize your cart you need a hull to attach your desired updates to. Wood can be used for really simple item transfer, but to farm wheat or wood, you need at least an iron one

questDatabase.name: Cart modules: Wood cutter
questDatabase.description: The basic wood cutter will break after a while, but you never have to replace it. It can be simply repaired with Diamonds

questDatabase.name: Basic transport pipe
questDatabase.description: These pipes are rather simple and won't do anything on their own; But in combination with Transfer Nodes, you'll soon find out how great they are. Also, given the correct updates, they even surpass most other transfer systems

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Items
questDatabase.description: In order to transfer items, you need so called "nodes". There are some for pushing items into a pipe system, and later you'll have access to nodes that are able to pull items from attached inventories

questDatabase.name: Basic transport: Fluids
questDatabase.description: Just like item nodes, liquid nodes transfer.. liquids. But probably the best thing: They can all utilize the same transfer pipe!

questDatabase.name: Accelerated plant growth
questDatabase.description: Plants grow very slowly, you might've discovered that by now. So why not do something against that? A watering can will come in handy very soon

questDatabase.name: Gotta catch 'em all
questDatabase.description: Sure, you can use wheat/potatoes/carrots to make animals follow you back to your base, but that can be tedious. A golden lasso is a proper solution for that

questDatabase.name: Basic monster protection
questDatabase.description: Spawning monsters in or near your base can be annoying. Especially if you happen to get a silverfish creeper. Luckily, there is a way to prevent them to spawn at all

questDatabase.name: A quite different storage
questDatabase.description: Normal chests can fill up rather quickly if you happen to collect mob drops like swords and / or armor. By using a cabinet, you can store up to 270 items of the same type

questDatabase.name: Protect your base; Tier 1
questDatabase.description: One needs proper protection for his home. So why not get some turrets for safety? At the moment, 2 Turrets are available; "Potato" and "disposable item". I assume you can guess what they do and how they work...

questDatabase.name: Passive defense
questDatabase.description: A more "passive" approach to base defense are walls and fences. But seriously, where is the fun?

questDatabase.name: Turret base
questDatabase.description: Turrets must be placed on top of a turret base. Only the player who initially played the base can access and configure the turret; So don't worry about people taking your ammunition

questDatabase.name: Who needs that dirt anyways
questDatabase.description: You probably have a ton of items floating around in your base; So why not use it to kill enemies?

questDatabase.name: Don't play with food!
questDatabase.description: Use it to kill Zombies instead. Does only little damage, but hey, who cares?

questDatabase.name: Upgrades
questDatabase.description: Your turrets probably need more space to hold more ammunition, so why not get an upgrade for that?

questLines.name: Tier 2 - 32 EU (LV)
questLines.description: The first "Voltage" Tier of this pack. Things are getting easier...
